note.p: Colonial civil servant. Son of James Henry Brooks, surgeon, of Henley-upon-Thames. Studied at Guy’s Hospital, 1851; MRCSEng 1854. Surgeon to 1st Royal Regiment, Lancashire Militia, 1857. Medical officer, Seychelles, from 1858 until his retirement in 1883.
Census returns of England and Wales 1851 (The National Archives: Public Record Office HO107/1566/165/14)
Oxfordshire, England, Church of England births and baptisms, 1813–1915 (Ancestry.co.uk, accessed 5 September 2019)
